arlut.csd.ganymede.server
Class JythonEditObjectFactory

java.lang.Object
  arlut.csd.ganymede.server.JythonEditObjectFactory

public class JythonEditObjectFactory
extends java.lang.Object

This class is a factory for Jython-based DBEditObject subclasses. It will attempt to load the source for these subclasses from an external location that is specified in the options of the given DBObjectBase.

It implements the 3 required factory methods that are analogues of the 3 constructors for all DBEditObject constructors.

          The Jython interpreter that's responsible for loading the external source file and instantiating a Java class from it.

factory

private static DBEditObject factory(DBObjectBase base,
                                    Invid invid,
                                    DBEditSet editset,
                                    DBObject original)

This is the workhorse factory method that the constructors all end up calling in the end. This function will simply pass all of the possible constructor parameters to the Jython-based DBEditObject, whose constructor is smart enough to determine which superclass constructor to call.

This should never be called directly...use one of the other 3 public factory methods instead.

initializeInterpreter

private static void initializeInterpreter()

Sets up the Jython interpreter and ensures that it can find any requisite external libraries

loadJythonClass

private static DBEditObject loadJythonClass(java.lang.String uri,
                                            DBObjectBase base,
                                            Invid invid,
                                            DBEditSet editset,
                                            DBObject original)

This method takes the given URI and transforms the Jython text it points to into a Java object. All of the other arguments as simply passed to the Jython text's constructor.

This will only load the Jython text once...after that it's cached. To unload the uri's class definition, use the unloadURI method.

Returns:
a newly constructed DBEditObject subclass

unloadURI

public static void unloadURI(java.lang.String uri)

Removes the class definition associated with the given URI from the class cache. This method should only be used to designate that the next time the given URI is loaded, you should bypass the cache.

Parameters:
uri - the uri we want to reset. If this is null, then ALL of the class definitions in the cache will be unloaded

unloadAllURIs

public static void unloadAllURIs()

Similar to unloadURI, except this method will unload ALL of the class definitions in the cache.
